ovdesc.p: This file contains details of all the carriers available in Delivery. To enable a carrier, it must be specified on the Delivery Parameter file, DE.PARM.

The id of this file is the name of the carrier, as used in DE.PRODUCT. each record contains the address type to be used for the carrier (i.e when accessing DE.ADDRESS), the formatting rules (DE.FORMAT.carrier) and the carrier module (e.g. DE.O.CC.SWIFT). If the carrier module is GENERIC, i.e. the messages are handled by the generic program DE.CC.GENERIC, interface must be specified. The interface must reference a record on DE.INTERFACE, which contains details of the protocol for all generic interfaces (non-generic interface details are stored on the parameter file, DE.PARM).

When the record is authorised, formatting and carrier files are created if they do not already exist. These files are F.DE.O.MSG.format-module and F.DE.O.PRI.format-module for the formatting files and F.DE.O.MSG.interface and F.DE.I.MSG.interface for the interface files.

desc.p: Specifies the inward formatting module to be used. The rules describing the formatting of the messages should therefore exist on the file, DE.FORMAT.format-module, e.g. DE.FORMAT.SWIFT. The formatting of these messages is done by the program DE.I.FORMAT.format-module.MESSAGE, e.g. DE.I.FORMAT.SWIFT.MESSAGE. Therefore, this program should exist.

e.g. A record may be specified on DE.CARRIER with an id of TELEXF. Messages may be formatted using a format module of TLXF (DE.FORMAT.TLXF) but may use TELEX addresses.
